Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Anthony W. Olsen was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
in Wisconsin State Prison System consecutive. Defendant is entitled to 132 days presentene credit.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge within 60 days (4/11/16) through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office or set up a payment plan within said time.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

Defendant to engage in treatment on a weekly basis.

supervisions.notes: shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.

Defendant Anthony W. Olsen in court with attorney Todd Allen Snow.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Snow is heard, are not prepared to go forward with plea today. Snow provides letter that state's if he moves to Dodge County he will get services now, Court will consider, for now motion to move is denied.  Last plea date to be scheduled, if this new date is not used will be put on trial calendar.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.

(1:00) Defendant Anthony W. Olsen in custody via video w/o counsel (told does not qualify).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond, open FDL case that was to have P&S this morning, violated occupational, .183 bac, requests $60,000 cash, not leave state, no drinking, bars, no driving; Def. heard; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 3/26/15 at 3pm in Br. 3 & Review set 3/25/15 at 8:15am in Br. 3; Court sets $60,000 CASH Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Restrictions on travel: May not leave State of Wisconsin.
